intro: Schrebera americana, commonly known as the American schrebera, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Schrebera americana produces small, red berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
